meanings.definition: A verse of six metrical feet.
meanings.sent1: The poet crafted a beautiful senarius for the epic poem.
meanings.sent2: In the play, the actors recited a senarius with perfect rhythm.
meanings.sent3: The senarius walked into the bar and ordered a drink - it was a poetic night!
meanings.sent4: Her dance moves flowed like a senarius, each step perfectly timed.
meanings.sent5: The senarius in the song painted a vivid picture of the hero's journey.

meanings.definition: Consisting of or pertaining to the number six.
meanings.sent1: The senarius puzzle had six pieces that fit together perfectly.
meanings.sent2: The team won the game with a senarius score of six goals.
meanings.sent3: The senarius cupcakes were a hit at the party, each decorated with six sprinkles.
meanings.sent4: The garden was filled with senarius flowers, blooming in groups of six.
meanings.sent5: The senarius pattern on the fabric repeated six times, creating a harmonious design.

meanings.sent1: The family reunion included a senarius of cousins, all gathered around the table.
meanings.sent2: The band consisted of a senarius of musicians, each playing a different instrument.
meanings.sent3: The senarius of puppies wagged their tails in unison, a delightful sight.
meanings.sent4: The senarius of stars shone brightly in the night sky, forming a constellation.
meanings.sent5: The senarius of books on the shelf caught her eye, each one waiting to be read.
